nodes.name: quantumMechanics
nodes.title: Quantum Mechanics
nodes.description: A fundamental theory in physics describing nature at atomic and subatomic scales.
nodes.generalKnowledge: Quantum mechanics introduces concepts like wave-particle duality, uncertainty principle, and probability waves.

nodes.name: waveParticleDuality
nodes.title: Wave-Particle Duality
nodes.description: The concept that every particle exhibits both wave and particle properties.
nodes.generalKnowledge: Demonstrated through experiments showing particles like electrons exhibit interference patterns.

nodes.name: uncertaintyPrinciple
nodes.title: Uncertainty Principle
nodes.description: A fundamental limit to the precision with which certain pairs of physical properties can be known.
nodes.generalKnowledge: Formulated by Werner Heisenberg, it states that position and momentum cannot both be precisely determined.

nodes.name: quantumEntanglement
nodes.title: Quantum Entanglement
nodes.description: A physical phenomenon where particles remain interconnected regardless of distance.
nodes.generalKnowledge: Entangled particles have correlated properties, leading to instantaneous state determination.

nodes.name: schrodingersEquation
nodes.title: Schr√∂dinger's Equation
nodes.description: A mathematical equation that describes how the quantum state of a physical system changes over time.
nodes.generalKnowledge: Central to quantum mechanics, it allows the calculation of the wave function of a system.

nodes.name: quantumTunneling
nodes.title: Quantum Tunneling
nodes.description: A quantum phenomenon where particles pass through potential barriers they classically shouldn't.
nodes.generalKnowledge: Essential for technologies like tunnel diodes and the nuclear fusion in stars.

nodes.name: quantumFieldTheory
nodes.title: Quantum Field Theory
nodes.description: A theoretical framework that combines classical field theory, special relativity, and quantum mechanics.
nodes.generalKnowledge: Describes how particles are excitations in their respective fields.

nodes.name: doubleSlitExperiment
nodes.title: Double-Slit Experiment
nodes.description: An experiment demonstrating the fundamental principles of quantum mechanics.
nodes.generalKnowledge: Shows that particles like electrons produce interference patterns, exhibiting wave-like behavior.

nodes.name: heisenberg
nodes.title: Werner Heisenberg
nodes.description: A pioneering physicist in the development of quantum mechanics.
nodes.generalKnowledge: Known for formulating the Uncertainty Principle.

nodes.name: bellTheorem
nodes.title: Bell's Theorem
nodes.description: A theorem that shows that certain predictions of quantum mechanics are incompatible with local hidden variable theories.
nodes.generalKnowledge: Provides a way to test the validity of quantum entanglement experimentally.

nodes.name: waveFunction
nodes.title: Wave Function
nodes.description: A mathematical description of the quantum state of a system.
nodes.generalKnowledge: Encapsulates the probabilities of a system's measurable properties.

nodes.name: semiconductors
nodes.title: Semiconductors
nodes.description: Materials with electrical conductivity between conductors and insulators.
nodes.generalKnowledge: Essential for modern electronics, utilizing quantum tunneling in devices like tunnel diodes.

nodes.name: standardModel
nodes.title: Standard Model
nodes.description: A theory concerning the electromagnetic, weak, and strong nuclear interactions.
nodes.generalKnowledge: Describes the fundamental particles and forces, except gravity.
